title: Australian man's desperate search for man called Pete who found his wallet in Melksham in the UK
text:
An Australian man who lost his wallet in a small UK town was shocked to find it had been mailed back to his home by a good Samaritan named Pete.

Richard Morris, 61, from Smiths Gully in the north-west of Melbourne, left his wallet on top of a rental car in Melksham, in Wiltshire, in August and drove off.

But six weeks later, he received a surprise package containing his untouched wallet and a handwritten note.

'Found this on the side of the road in Melksham, Wiltshite. Hope it gets back to you alright. Kind regards, Pete,' the note read.

Mr Morris said he is now on a quest to get in contact with Pete to thank him for his selfless gesture.

Richard Morris, who lost his wallet in the UK, has had the valuable item returned to him by a man named Pete

The untouched wallet containing cash, ID and two credit cards, included a handwritten letter

The landscape designer, who frequently travels to the UK for work, said his wallet had contained a total of $70AUD (£37), his ID and two credit cards.

The package did not include a return address for Pete's home.

'I'm keen to find this guy. It was an act of generosity,' Mr Morris told Daily Mail Australia.

'I don't want to be best buddies. I just want a number to thank him.

'Everything was in there, including cash, credit cards and my entire identity.'

Mr Morris lost his wallet during a trip to a quiet town in the UK called Melksham

He realised he had lost his wallet when he went to pay for items at the checkout of a grocery store.

Mr Morris began retracing his steps and and even reported the incident to local police.

He is pleading for Pete or anyone who may know of him to contact him via email on richardcmorris@icloud.com.
description: Richard Morris, 61, from Smiths Gully in the north-west of Melbourne's CBD, left his wallet on a rental car in Melksham, west of London in August and drove off.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
